description: The given raster data cubes is converted into a set of point samples per geometry given. The samples are always taken at the pixel center.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The raster data cube to extract a sample from.

parameters.name: geometries
parameters.description:
Geometries to extract samples for. If not given or `null`, the bounding box of the raster data cube is used as the Polygon to sample for.

To maximize interoperability, a nested `GeometryCollection` should be avoided. Furthermore, a `GeometryCollection` composed of a single type of geometries should be avoided in favour of the corresponding multi-part type (e.g. `MultiPolygon`).

parameters.name: num_samples
parameters.description:
The number of samples.

The number of samples can be given in three different ways:

* An integer >= 1: The absolute number of samples to take.
* A number > 0 and < 1: The fraction of samples to take, e.g. 0.5 to take a sample for 50% of the data. To take a sample for 100% of the data (i.e. each pixel) see the next point.
* If not given or `null`, it takes a sample for each pixel.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: A randomization seed to use for random sampling. If not given or `null`, no seed is used and results may differ on subsequent use.

returns.description: Returns a vector data cube with the sampled points as `MultiPoint` per geometry given.
